= value =
 field: integer '''.value'''[index] (Read/Write)
 
The '''value''' field provides indexed access to an object's value array, which contains object-specific numeric data.

== Description ==
The '''value''' field is an array of 5 integers (indices 0-4) that stores object-specific data. The meaning and usage of each value index varies depending on the object's [[#uobj|objecttype]]. This field allows direct access to modify or read object properties such as weapon damage, armor protection, food nutrition, spell power, and other type-specific attributes.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| obj.value[index] || integer || Returns the integer value at the specified index (0-4)
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* UNIT_ST_OBJ (Object)

== Examples ==
=== Basic Usage ===
 dilbegin check_weapon_damage();
 var
   weapon : unitptr;
   damage : integer;
 
 code
 {
   weapon := self.equipment[WEAR_WIELD];
   if (weapon != null and weapon.objecttype == ITEM_WEAPON)
   {
     damage := weapon.value[1]; // Get weapon damage
     sendtext("Weapon damage: " + itoa(damage) + "<br/>", activator);
   }
 } dilend

=== Food and Drink ===
 dilbegin check_food_quality();
 var
   food : unitptr;
   quality : integer;
 
 code
 {
   food := self.inside;
   if (food != null and food.objecttype == ITEM_FOOD)
   {
     quality := food.value[0]; // Get food quality/nutrition
     if (quality > 0)
     {
       sendtext("This food looks fresh and nutritious.<br/>", activator);
     }
     else
     {
       sendtext("This food appears to be spoiled.<br/>", activator);
     }
   }
 } dilend

=== Container Management ===
 dilbegin check_container_status();
 var
   container : unitptr;
 
 code
 {
   container := self;
   if (container.objecttype == ITEM_CONTAINER)
   {
     if (container.value[0] == 1) // Check if container is closable
     {
       sendtext("This container can be opened and closed.<br/>", activator);
     }
     if (container.value[1] == 1) // Check if container is closed
     {
       sendtext("The container is currently closed.<br/>", activator);
     }
   }
 } dilend

=== Light Source ===
 dilbegin check_light_duration();
 var
   light : unitptr;
   hours_left : integer;
 
 code
 {
   light := self.equipment[WEAR_HOLD];
   if (light != null and light.objecttype == ITEM_LIGHT)
   {
     hours_left := light.value[0]; // Get remaining hours
     if (hours_left > 0)
     {
       sendtext("The light will burn for " + itoa(hours_left) + " more hours.<br/>", activator);
     }
     else
     {
       sendtext("The light has burned out.<br/>", activator);
     }
   }
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* Valid indices are 0 through 4 (inclusive)
* The meaning of each index depends on the object's [[#uobj|objecttype]]
* Common uses include:
** Weapons: value[0] = weapon type, value[1] = damage, value[2] = bonus damage
** Armor: value[0] = armor type, value[1] = protection, value[2] = enchantment
** Food/Drink: value[0] = quality/nutrition, value[1] = poison strength, value[2] = hunger/thirst satisfaction
** Containers: value[0] = closable flag, value[1] = closed flag, value[2] = pick-proof flag
** Lights: value[0] = hours remaining, value[1] = illumination level
** Spell items: value[0] = spell power, value[1] = spell number, value[2] = charges
* Always check the object's [[#uobj|objecttype]] before interpreting values
* Values are saved with the object if it's a savable item

== Error Handling ==
* Accessing an index outside 0-4 will result in a runtime error
* Accessing '''value''' on a non-object unit will result in a runtime error
* The field automatically handles bounds checking based on the object's value array size
* Invalid object types may return unexpected values or cause errors
